meanings.definition: To turn or rotate something in a circular motion.
meanings.sent1: She was twisting the lid off the jar.
meanings.sent2: The dancer was twisting gracefully on stage.
meanings.sent3: The cat was twisting its body to catch its tail.
meanings.sent4: The river was twisting through the valley like a serpent.
meanings.sent5: His hands were twisting the rope into a knot.

meanings.definition: To distort or change the shape of something.
meanings.sent1: He was twisting the wire into a strange shape.
meanings.sent2: The artist was twisting the clay into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The wind was twisting the tree branches into odd shapes.
meanings.sent4: The heat was twisting the metal beams out of alignment.
meanings.sent5: She was twisting the balloon into a funny animal shape.

meanings.definition: To move in a winding or spiral course.
meanings.sent1: The road was twisting through the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The snake was twisting around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The river was twisting and turning like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent4: The vines were twisting up the trellis in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The tornado was twisting violently across the plains.

meanings.definition: To change direction suddenly or sharply.
meanings.sent1: The car was twisting around the corner at high speed.
meanings.sent2: The wind was twisting the umbrella inside out.
meanings.sent3: The plot of the movie was twisting unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: His words were twisting the conversation in a new direction.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind was twisting the kite in the sky.
